<tr class="athing comtr" id="43191766"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="0"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="0"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43191766&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43191766"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">
<a class="hnuser" href="user?id=trhway">trhway</a> <span class="age" title="2025-02-27T06:05:02 1740636302"><a href="item?id=43191766">23 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_43191766"></span> <span class="navs">
             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43189947">prev</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43189641">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43191766" n="1">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00">why not inertial confinement? Z-pinch at Sandia has been already for 20 years generating fusion conditions. Livermore NIF got that "break-even" in the recent years, and with solid-state lasers the efficiency would at least order of magnitude better than the old lasers the NIF was using. And the only real Q&gt;&gt;1 fusion we've got working so far - H-bombs - is inertial confinement. So, in some sense inertial confinement is "just" an engineering problem of efficiently "taming"/reproducing at smaller scale the H-bomb with lasers or Z-pinch (or both at the same time, plus the magnetic compression that NIF added to the lasers to get that "break-even") whereis, as far as i see, any Tokamak (or any other magnetic confinement) is still yet to demonstrate any similar results.</div>
<div class="reply"> <p><font size="1">
<u><a href="reply?id=43191766&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246%2343191766" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u>
</font>
</p></div></div></td></tr>
</table></td></tr>
<tr class="athing comtr" id="43189641"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="0"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="0"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43189641&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43189641"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">
<a class="hnuser" href="user?id=rgmerk">rgmerk</a> <span class="age" title="2025-02-26T23:46:50 1740613610"><a href="item?id=43189641">6 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_43189641"></span> <span class="navs">
             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43191766">prev</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43187467">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43189641" n="1">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00">Hi guys.<p>I don't claim to understand any of the physics and engineering challenges of fusion, but from all the general-interest material published, and the long history of fusion research, it seems that the capital cost of a fusion propulsion system is going to be far in excess of a conventional marine engine.  I guess the hope is that the very cheap fuel might reduce the operational expenses such that it can compete economically.<p>However, if you've got a fusion power plant that a) has essentially free and practically-massless fuel, and b) the relationship between rated power output and capital cost is less than linear (again, not an expert on the physics but true of pretty much all such systems), I wonder whether the way to make a fusion ship economically competitive against conventional shipping is to max out the power and build a ship capable of much faster speeds than conventional ships.<p>I mean, we used to operate passenger liners back in the 1950s that averaged about 35 knots across the Atlantic, so presumably we could do considerably better than that.</p></p></p></div>
<div class="reply"> <p><font size="1">
<u><a href="reply?id=43189641&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246%2343189641" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u>
</font>
</p></div></div></td></tr>
</table></td></tr>
<tr class="athing comtr" id="43187467"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="0"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="0"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43187467&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43187467"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">
<a class="hnuser" href="user?id=nradov">nradov</a> <span class="age" title="2025-02-26T19:54:38 1740599678"><a href="item?id=43187467">10 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_43187467"></span> <span class="navs">
             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43189641">prev</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43190116">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43187467" n="3">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00">How do you intend to address the crew training issue? Merchant vessel operators tend to hire low wage seamen with limited technical training, plus a few qualified engineering officers. Marine diesel engines are pretty simple and robust but I would imagine that operating a fusion plant might require more technical training.</div>

<tr class="athing comtr" id="43188491"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="1"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="40"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43188491&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43188491"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">
<a class="hnuser" href="user?id=wiml">wiml</a> <span class="age" title="2025-02-26T21:34:23 1740605663"><a href="item?id=43188491">8 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_43188491"></span> <span class="navs">
             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43187467">parent</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43190116">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43188491" n="2">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00">Back of the envelope (and some quick googling), a large container ship burns hundreds of tons of fuel per day, at a cost of 700-1000 $/t. Plus, all that fuel occupies tonnage that isn't carrying paying cargo. If you can save on that with a magic new reactor, the cost of a well trained tech on every ship isn't going to break the budget.</div>
<div class="reply"> <p><font size="1">
<u><a href="reply?id=43188491&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246%2343188491" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u>

<tr class="athing comtr" id="43189352"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="2"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="80"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43189352&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43189352"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">
<a class="hnuser" href="user?id=nradov">nradov</a> <span class="age" title="2025-02-26T23:11:04 1740611464"><a href="item?id=43189352">7 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_43189352"></span> <span class="navs">
             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43187467">root</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43188491">parent</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43190116">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43189352" n="1">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00">Fusion fuel isn't going to be free. Fusion reactors aren't magic: in a sense they're very traditional in that they will be used to turn water into superheated steam that spins a steam turbine to drive the propeller. Just like in 1897. Even if the fusion reactor could somehow magically be made maintenance free, the steam plant will be maintenance intensive. Ask any engineering officer who worked on a steam plant, regardless of whether the heat source was fossil fuel or fission. This is part of the reason why merchant ships switched from steam turbines to diesel engines decades ago: lower maintenance costs and lower crew training requirements.<p>Maritime fusion power could be a good idea but you have to evaluate complete system lifecycle cost instead of looking at just one component.</p></div>
<div class="reply"> <p><font size="1">
<u><a href="reply?id=43189352&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246%2343189352" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u>
</font>
</p></div></div></td></tr>
</table></td></tr>

<tr class="athing comtr" id="43186054"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="2"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="80"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43186054&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43186054"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">
<a class="hnuser" href="user?id=dghlsakjg">dghlsakjg</a> <span class="age" title="2025-02-26T17:45:28 1740591928"><a href="item?id=43186054">12 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_43186054"></span> <span class="navs">
             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43185654">root</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43185894">parent</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43185886">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43186054" n="1">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00">The argument that I've heard is that roof installed solar is incredibly expensive compared to all other solar. Add in the other compromises with orientation and obstructed sunlight, and you quickly realize that it is likely better to install solar and batteries at dedicated power facilities that scale better than to distribute the infrastructure in residential neighborhoods.</div>
<div class="reply"> <p><font size="1">
<u><a href="reply?id=43186054&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246%2343186054" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u>
</font>
</p></div></div></td></tr>
</table></td></tr>

<tr class="athing comtr" id="43189763"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="1"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="40"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43189763&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43189763"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">
<a class="hnuser" href="user?id=condensedcrab">condensedcrab</a> <span class="age" title="2025-02-27T00:02:56 1740614576"><a href="item?id=43189763">6 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_43189763"></span> <span class="navs">
             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43188623">parent</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43186177">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43189763" n="1">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00">The scaling laws for fusion follow a power law for size and magnetic field (see <a href="https://physics.stackexchange.com/questions/175830/nuclear-fusion-scaling-with-reactor-size" rel="nofollow">https://physics.stackexchange.com/questions/175830/nuclear-f...</a>), which allow for better break even for commercial applications for larger fusion reactors like ITER. All of the smaller fusion reactors proposed need to use high Tc superconducting wire to generator higher magnetic fields for smaller reactors.</div>
<div class="reply"> <p><font size="1">
<u><a href="reply?id=43189763&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246%2343189763" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u>
</font>
</p></div></div></td></tr>
</table></td></tr>

<div class="commtext c00">HTS was available in ceramic form, but ceramics sorta suck to work with. So potential users had to wait for people to make them into wires, which was apparently a fat pain in the ass, and then for that technology to be commercialized, all of which took until the 2010s.</div>

<tr class="athing comtr" id="43186955"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="1"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="40"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43186955&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43186955"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">

             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43186346">parent</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43186803">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43186955" n="1">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00">It's a heavy black box which emits neutrons.<p>The good news is that neutrons are easily absorbed by steel and water.<p>The bad news is that the resulting irradiated steel isn't anywhere near as strong as it was pre-irradiation.<p><a href="https://www.science.org/content/article/fusion-power-may-run-fuel-even-gets-started" rel="nofollow">https://www.science.org/content/article/fusion-power-may-run...</a></p></p></p></div>
<div class="reply"> <p><font size="1">
<u><a href="reply?id=43186955&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246%2343186955" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u>
</font>
</p></div></div></td></tr>

<tr class="athing comtr" id="43186803"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="0"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="0"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">

<tr class="athing comtr noshow" id="43186246"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="2"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="80"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43186246&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43186246"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">
<a class="hnuser" href="user?id=bbor">bbor</a> <span class="age" title="2025-02-26T18:04:15 1740593055"><a href="item?id=43186246">12 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_43186246"></span> <span class="navs">
             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43185828">root</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43185865">parent</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43188741">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43186246" n="2">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00">I think the point being made is more subtle than you're appreciating: it's not just any defense firm, it's a defense firm founded by engineers who have worked on multiple Elon projects. I understand we try to stay away from politics here, but speaking objectively+non-normatively: Elon has been known to greatly favor working with people that have worked at his companies, and he now has immense influence over the contracting processing of the federal government.<p>In other words: two Cybertruck engineers starting a defense company in February 2025 is naturally going to raise some eyebrows, especially when they're selling a technology that they're counting on other people to invent soon.<p>More interestingly/generally, your mention of confirmation bias/Bader-Meinhoff raises a question for me: is Y-Combinator really investing more in government and heavy industry as it appears? And it looks like the answer is <i>yes</i>, though it's still a tiny minority compared to general B2B SaaS companies:<p><a href="https://jaredheyman.medium.com/on-the-last-decade-of-y-combinator-fa19b387846a" rel="nofollow">https://jaredheyman.medium.com/on-the-last-decade-of-y-combi...</a><p>Government is a bigger slicer than it's been since 2017, and similar for industry. More drastically, the pool of companies has <i>greatly</i> constricted in geographic terms, with almost all of the 2024 batch coming from the US. Most importantly--as many of y'all probably already know, but I didn't--they just backed their first pure-defense startup in August, Ares Cruise Missiles.<p><a href="https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/ares-industries">https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/ares-industries</a><p>As far as company mottos go, "Missiles are cool" is a fucking terrifying one... Every day I fear the LessWrong people were less wrong than I thought they were.</p></p></p></p></p></p></div>
<div class="reply"> <p><font size="1">
<u><a href="reply?id=43186246&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246%2343186246" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u>
</font>
</p></div></div></td></tr>
</table></td></tr>
<tr class="athing comtr noshow" id="43187650"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="3"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="120"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43187650&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43187650"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">
<a class="hnuser" href="user?id=dang">dang</a> <span class="age" title="2025-02-26T20:10:01 1740600601"><a href="item?id=43187650">10 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_43187650"></span> <span class="navs">
             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43185828">root</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43186246">parent</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43188741">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43187650" n="1">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00">You guys are welcome to connect whatever dots you like, but the idea that YC funding decisions would change depending on the politics of the CEOs of the companies the founders used to work for strikes me as absurd, and I think I have a basis for saying that.<p>YC's process looks something like this: smart founders? check. Technical? check. Big important problem? check. Technically credible on <i>this</i> problem? check. "Did $Thing at $Company" can help on that last point for obvious reasons, but the idea of some triple-bank-shot collusion/corruption with Big Political Players is just Too Much Internet.<p>This matters! I would hate it if any smart, technical, wants-to-work-on-big-problem founder were to read HN threads and think "I don't have connections, so I guess YC is not for me." Please don't anyone think that! If that's you, then YC is for people just like you. You have as good a chance as anyone, precisely because these externalities <i>don't</i> make the difference in this context that they might in others.<p>To shift gears to your other question:<p>&gt; <i>is Y-Combinator really investing more in government and heavy industry as it appears?</i><p>I don't know, but it's possible. However, the reason might not be what you'd expect. Trends among YC startups have to do with what founders want to work on, and that is mostly determined by macro factors beyond YC.<p>I suppose both my points could be summed up like this: "YC is all about the founders". A nice, simple, true sentence, but with a lot of implications that are easy to miss.</p></p></p></p></p></p></div>
<div class="reply"> <p><font size="1">
<u><a href="reply?id=43187650&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246%2343187650" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u>
</font>
</p></div></div></td></tr>
</table></td></tr>

<tr class="athing comtr" id="43190128"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="0"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="0"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43190128&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43190128"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">
<a class="hnuser" href="user?id=jacknews">jacknews</a> <span class="age" title="2025-02-27T00:50:47 1740617447"><a href="item?id=43190128">5 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_43190128"></span> <span class="navs">
             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43188741">prev</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43187285">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43190128" n="1">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00">naysayer here, but best of luck anyway<p>it's definitely a good choice to target a niche market, but imho (DT) fusion will never be competitive on earth unless theres a breakthrough in cold fusion, muon fusion, etc<p>the right niche is probably spaceships<p>fusion is still worth pursuing; i always judge these efforts by their scientific output rather than their chances of reaching commercially viable fusion (zero)</p></p></p></div>
<div class="reply"> <p><font size="1">

<tr class="athing comtr" id="43187285"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="0"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="0"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43187285&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43187285"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">
<a class="hnuser" href="user?id=Out_of_Characte">Out_of_Characte</a> <span class="age" title="2025-02-26T19:36:47 1740598607"><a href="item?id=43187285">10 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_43187285"></span> <span class="navs">
             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43190128">prev</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43186316">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43187285" n="4">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00">The mere fact that you're proposing doing this on a moving vessel already tells me you're completely incompetent. No one has made fusion net positive, somehow building a net positive fusion reactor on a boat would be fine I guess but to suggest its better than enriched uranium is dishonest. You'll have more luck building a regular fission reactor on a commercial freighter than verify a fusion reactor for any ocean capable ship.<p>Have you modeled how plasma will behave when your reactor walls move tens of meters in any possible direction while rotating violently in every degree of freedom? Mind you, its not the plasma I'm concerned about. The ideal gas law keeps the atmosphere nice and steady. Its more of a combination of high magnetic field strength with salt water everywhere around the reactor that when destabilised in the slightest will cause a massive implosion.<p>&gt;Jason and I come from SpaceX and Tesla
&gt;in the coming decades (2050-2060)
&gt;we'll pivot to decarbonising the grid and saving the world<p>just make a fission reactor, on land, in a pit, with a massive concrete wall between me and potential neutrons.</p></p></p></div>
<div class="reply"> <p><font size="1">
<u><a href="reply?id=43187285&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246%2343187285" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u>
</font>
</p></div></div></td></tr>
</table></td></tr>
<tr class="athing comtr" id="43187474"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="1"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="40"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43187474&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43187474"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">
<a class="hnuser" href="user?id=jfengel">jfengel</a> <span class="age" title="2025-02-26T19:55:12 1740599712"><a href="item?id=43187474">10 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_43187474"></span> <span class="navs">
             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43187285">parent</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43186316">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43187474" n="3">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00"><i>You'll have more luck building a regular fission reactor on a commercial freighter than verify a fusion reactor for any ocean capable ship.</i><p>That part, I'm not so sure about. Enriched uranium is potentially dangerous stuff, and has to be guarded closely. In a world with literal pirates, getting one on a commercial ship sounds very, very unlikely.<p>As you say, fusion seems equally unlikely, albeit from a physics standpoint rather than a regulatory standpoint. It's hard to tell whether the immovable object of physics would dominate the unstoppable force of regulation, or vice versa.</p></p></div>
<div class="reply"> <p><font size="1">
<u><a href="reply?id=43187474&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246%2343187474" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u>

</p></div></div></td></tr>
</table></td></tr>
<tr class="athing comtr" id="43188059"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="2"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="80"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">
<center><a href="vote?id=43188059&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246" id="up_43188059"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center> </td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead">
<a class="hnuser" href="user?id=Out_of_Characte">Out_of_Characte</a> <span class="age" title="2025-02-26T20:51:04 1740603064"><a href="item?id=43188059">9 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_43188059"></span> <span class="navs">
             | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43187285">root</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43187474">parent</a> | <a aria-hidden="true" class="clicky" href="#43188391">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" href="javascript:void(0)" id="43188059" n="1">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span> </span>
</span></div><br/><div class="comment">
<div class="commtext c00">We already have 70 years experience of <i>marine</i> nuclear reactors. Most of them highly enriched uranium or plutonium.<p>Submarines for electrolysis of water into breathable oxygen and electrical power for propulsion and aircraft carriers for its massive power density.<p>On the other hand, we have 0 years of operational experience with fusion reactors. We have 0 energy positive land based designs, 0 marine adaptations. We have discovered exactly 0 benefits of fusion reactor designs over fission. and I'm certain that we'll have more than 100 years of experience in commercial fission operation before we even have a single decade of net positive fusion energy.<p>Highly dangerous? Absolutely, but the giant weapons attached to these nuclear marine reactors have killed far more people than those reactors. Hell, those aircraft carriers experience more radiation from coal power plants than their own reactor. And I'm not kidding.</p></p></p></div>
<div class="reply"> <p><font size="1">
<u><a href="reply?id=43188059&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D43185246%2343188059" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u>
</font>
</p></div></div></td></tr>
</table></td></tr>
<tr class="athing comtr" id="43188391"><td><table border="0"> <tr> <td class="ind" indent="2"><img height="1" src="s.gif" width="80"/></td><td class="votelinks" valign="top">

\u003c/video\u003e\n\u003c/details\u003e\n\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTach can enforce:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e📋 Imports only come from \u003ca href=\"https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/configuration\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eNo cycles\u003c/a\u003e in the dependency graph\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTach is:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e🌎 Open source\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e🐍 Installable via pip\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e🔧 Able to be adopted incrementally\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e⚡ Implemented with no runtime impact\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e♾️ Interoperable with your existing systems\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv guide you through initial project setup.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eRun:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\" tach init\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e tach init\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAfter an introductory message, you will see a file tree interface allowing you to interactively configure your project.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eUse the arrow keys to navigate, and mark each module boundary with 'Enter'. You can mark all of your top-level Python packages, or just a few that you want to track.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf your Python code lives below your project root, or if you are working in a monorepo with multiple Python packages, mark your Python \u003ca href=\"https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/configuration#source-roots\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003esource roots\u003c/a\u003e using the 's' key.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eEnforcement\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-enforcement\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Enforcement\" href=\"#enforcement\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTach comes with a cli command to enforce the boundaries that you just set up! From the root of your Python project, run:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"tach check\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003etach check\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou will see:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"✅ All modules validated!\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e✅ All modules validated\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003e!\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can validate that Tach is working by:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoving an item from the \u003ccode\u003edepends_on\u003c/code\u003e key in \u003ccode\u003etach.toml\u003c/code\u003e, or marking it as \u003ca href=\"https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/deprecate\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003edeprecated\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBy adding an import between modules that didn't previously import from each other.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eGive both a try and run \u003ccode\u003etach check\u003c/code\u003e again. This will generate an error:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"❌ tach/check.py[L8]: Cannot use 'tach.filesystem'. Module 'tach' cannot depend on 'tach.filesystem'.\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e❌ tach/check.py[L8]: Cannot use \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e'\u003c/span\u003etach.filesystem\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e'\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e. Module \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e'\u003c/span\u003etach\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e'\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e cannot depend on \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e'\u003c/span\u003etach.filesystem\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e'\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e.\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eEach error indicates an import which violates your dependencies. If your terminal supports hyperlinks, click on the file path to go directly to the error.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWhen an error is detected, \u003ccode\u003etach check\u003c/code\u003e will exit with a non-zero code. It can be easily integrated with CI/CD, \u003ca href=\"https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/commands#tach-install\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ePre-commit hooks\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\"https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Gauge.tach\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eVS Code\u003c/a\u003e, and more!\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eExtras\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-extras\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Extras\" href=\"#extras\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eVisualize your dependency graph.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"tach show [--web]\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003etach show [--web]\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTach will generate a graph of your dependencies. Here's what this looks like for Tach:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" href=\"/gauge-sh/tach/blob/main/docs/assets/tach_show.png\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"/gauge-sh/tach/raw/main/docs/assets/tach_show.png\" alt=\"tach show\" style=\"max-width: format\u003c/a\u003e locally, simply running \u003ccode\u003etach show\u003c/code\u003e will generate \u003ccode\u003etach_module_graph.dot\u003c/code\u003e in your working <a href="https://pypi.Python.org/pypi/tach" rel="nofollow"><img alt="version" data-canonical-src="https://img.shields.io/pypi/v/tach.svg" src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/a0fb5304394c4a3cd5a87866b28441e8bad79e2ccb19b680a782a83b5cb1d8d8/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f707970692f762f746163682e737667" style="max-width: 100%;"/></a>
<a href="https://pypi.Python.org/pypi/tach" rel="nofollow"><img alt="license" data-canonical-src="https://img.shields.io/pypi/l/tach.svg" src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/9641499a279cc9dc7343fe80c9bab242138e2feb721a85dfdc28bc6c00b8166b/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f707970692f6c2f746163682e737667" style="max-width: 100%;"/></a>
<a href="https://pypi.Python.org/pypi/tach" rel="nofollow"><img alt="python" data-canonical-src="https://img.shields.io/pypi/pyversions/tach.svg" src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/1a1cbdbbf0252fda5f01be59ed06d02fe79f96dbdc22dc3bf669c8662499bcb1/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f707970692f707976657273696f6e732f746163682e737667" style="max-width: 100%;"/></a>
<a href="https://github.com/gauge-sh/tach/actions/workflows/ci.yml"><img alt="ci" src="https://github.com/gauge-sh/tach/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg" style="max-width: 100%;"/></a>
<a href="https://microsoft.github.io/pyright/" rel="nofollow"><img alt="pyright" data-canonical-src="https://microsoft.github.io/pyright/img/pyright_badge.svg" src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/8b43823cc31d9ccbd37b4571902b0115accd26ea7abfb68d5d0543cdd2d0f9c6/68747470733a2f2f6d6963726f736f66742e6769746875622e696f2f707972696768742f696d672f707972696768745f62616467652e737667" style="max-width: 100%;"/></a>
<a href="https://github.com/astral-sh/ruff"><img alt="ruff" data-canonical-src="https://img.shields.io/endpoint?url=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/astral-sh/ruff/main/assets/badge/v2.json" src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/051a04ae958f4a1a5d6444df4cdc520305eef93d5028e6d4c7cd16efa3136cd4/68747470733a2f2f696d672e736869656c64732e696f2f656e64706f696e743f75726c3d68747470733a2f2f7261772e67697468756275736572636f6e74656e742e636f6d2f61737472616c2d73682f727566662f6d61696e2f6173736574732f62616467652f76322e6a736f6e" style="max-width: 100%;"/></a></p>
<p dir="auto">Tach is a Python tool to enforce dependencies and interfaces, written in Rust.</p>
<p dir="auto">Tach is inspired by the <a href="https://www.milanjovanovic.tech/blog/what-is-a-modular-monolith" rel="nofollow">modular monolith</a> architecture.</p>
<p dir="auto"><a href="https://docs.gauge.sh" rel="nofollow">Docs</a></p>
<p dir="auto"><a href="https://discord.gg/Kz2TnszerR" rel="nofollow">Discord</a></p>
<div align="center" dir="auto">
<a href="/gauge-sh/tach/blob/main/docs/assets/light_logo.png" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img alt="gauge-logo" src="/gauge-sh/tach/raw/main/docs/assets/light_logo.png" style="max-width: 100%;" width="30%"/></a>
</div>
<details class="details-reset border rounded-2" open="">
<summary class="px-3 py-2">
<svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-device-camera-video" data-view-component="true" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16">
<path d="M16 3.75v8.5a.75.75 0 0 1-1.136.643L11 10.575v.675A1.75 1.75 0 0 1 9.25 13h-7.5A1.75 1.75 0 0 1 0 11.25v-6.5C0 3.784.784 3 1.75 3h7.5c.966 0 1.75.784 1.75 1.75v.675l3.864-2.318A.75.75 0 0 1 16 3.75Zm-6.5 1a.25.25 0 0 0-.25-.25h-7.5a.25.25 0 0 0-.25.25v6.5c0 .138.112.25.25.25h7.5a.25.25 0 0 0 .25-.25v-6.5ZM11 8.825l3.5 2.1v-5.85l-3.5 2.1Z"></path>
</svg>
<span aria-label="Video description Tach.Demo.mp4" class="m-1">Tach.Demo.mp4</span>
<span class="dropdown-caret"></span>
</summary>
<video class="d-block rounded-bottom-2 border-top width-fit" controls="controls" data-canonical-src="https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/10570340/417290452-11eec4a1-f80a-4f13-9ff3-91a9760133b6.mp4?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..zORG9TwBldCQmFhQpo5mlB_VRE6goNIoAXi4fwMj8MA" muted="muted" src="https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/10570340/417290452-11eec4a1-f80a-4f13-9ff3-91a9760133b6.mp4?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..zORG9TwBldCQmFhQpo5mlB_VRE6goNIoAXi4fwMj8MA" style="max-height:640px; min-height: 200px">
</video>
</details>
<p dir="auto">Tach can enforce:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>📋 Imports only come from <a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/configuration#modules" rel="nofollow">declared dependencies</a></li>
<li>🤝 Cross-module calls use the <a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/configuration#interfaces" rel="nofollow">public interface</a></li>
<li>⛓️‍💥 <a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/configuration" rel="nofollow">No cycles</a> in the dependency graph</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">Tach is:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>🌎 Open source</li>
<li>🐍 Installable via pip</li>
<li>🔧 Able to be adopted incrementally</li>
<li>⚡ Implemented with no runtime impact</li>
<li>♾️ Interoperable with your existing systems</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Getting Started</h2><a aria-label="Permalink: Getting Started" class="anchor" href="#getting-started" id="user-content-getting-started"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Installation</h3><a aria-label="Permalink: Installation" class="anchor" href="#installation" id="user-content-installation"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="pip install tach" dir="auto"><pre>pip install tach</pre></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Setup</h3><a aria-label="Permalink: Setup" class="anchor" href="#setup" id="user-content-setup"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Tach will guide you through initial project setup.</p>
<p dir="auto">Run:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=" tach init" dir="auto"><pre> tach init</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">After an introductory message, you will see a file tree interface allowing you to interactively configure your project.</p>
<p dir="auto">Use the arrow keys to navigate, and mark each module boundary with 'Enter'. You can mark all of your top-level Python packages, or just a few that you want to track.</p>
<p dir="auto">If your Python code lives below your project root, or if you are working in a monorepo with multiple Python packages, mark your Python <a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/configuration#source-roots" rel="nofollow">source roots</a> using the 's' key.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Enforcement</h3><a aria-label="Permalink: Enforcement" class="anchor" href="#enforcement" id="user-content-enforcement"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Tach comes with a cli command to enforce the boundaries that you just set up! From the root of your Python project, run:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="tach check" dir="auto"><pre>tach check</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">You will see:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="✅ All modules validated!" dir="auto"><pre>✅ All modules validated<span class="pl-k">!</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">You can validate that Tach is working by:</p>
<ol dir="auto">
<li>Removing an item from the <code>depends_on</code> key in <code>tach.toml</code>, or marking it as <a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/deprecate" rel="nofollow">deprecated</a></li>
<li>By adding an import between modules that didn't previously import from each other.</li>
</ol>
<p dir="auto">Give both a try and run <code>tach check</code> again. This will generate an error:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="❌ tach/check.py[L8]: Cannot use 'tach.filesystem'. Module 'tach' cannot depend on 'tach.filesystem'." dir="auto"><pre>❌ tach/check.py[L8]: Cannot use <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>tach.filesystem<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>. Module <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>tach<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span> cannot depend on <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>tach.filesystem<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>.</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Each error indicates an import which violates your dependencies. If your terminal supports hyperlinks, click on the file path to go directly to the error.</p>
<p dir="auto">When an error is detected, <code>tach check</code> will exit with a non-zero code. It can be easily integrated with CI/CD, <a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/commands#tach-install" rel="nofollow">Pre-commit hooks</a>, and <a href="https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Gauge.tach" rel="nofollow">VS Code</a>, and more!</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Extras</h3><a aria-label="Permalink: Extras" class="anchor" href="#extras" id="user-content-extras"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Visualize your dependency graph.</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="tach show [--web]" dir="auto"><pre>tach show [--web]</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Tach will generate a graph of your dependencies. Here's what this looks like for Tach:</p>
<p dir="auto"><a href="/gauge-sh/tach/blob/main/docs/assets/tach_show.png" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"><img alt="tach show" src="/gauge-sh/tach/raw/main/docs/assets/tach_show.png" style="max-width: 100%;"/></a></p>
<p dir="auto">Note that this graph is generated remotely with the contents of your <code>tach.toml</code> when running <code>tach show --web</code>.</p>
<p dir="auto">If you would like to use the <a href="https://graphviz.org/about/" rel="nofollow">GraphViz DOT format</a> locally, simply running <code>tach show</code> will generate <code>tach_module_graph.dot</code> in your working directory.</p>
<p dir="auto">You can view the dependencies and usages for a given path:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="tach report my_package/
# OR
tach report my_module.py" dir="auto"><pre>tach report my_package/
<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">#</span> OR</span>
tach report my_module.py</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">e.g.:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="&gt; tach report python/tach/filesystem
[Dependencies of 'python/tach/filesystem']
python/tach/filesystem/install.py[L6]: Import 'tach.hooks.build_pre_commit_hook_content'
python/tach/filesystem/project.py[L5]: Import 'tach.constants.CONFIG_FILE_NAME'
...
-------------------------------
[Usages of 'python/tach/filesystem']
python/tach/cache/access.py[L8]: Import 'tach.filesystem.find_project_config_root'
python/tach/cache/setup.py[L7]: Import 'tach.filesystem.find_project_config_root'
..." dir="auto"><pre><span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> tach report python/tach/filesystem
[Dependencies of <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>python/tach/filesystem<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>]
python/tach/filesystem/install.py[L6]: Import <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>tach.hooks.build_pre_commit_hook_content<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>
python/tach/filesystem/project.py[L5]: Import <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>tach.constants.CONFIG_FILE_NAME<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>
...
-------------------------------
[Usages of <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>python/tach/filesystem<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>]
python/tach/cache/access.py[L8]: Import <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>tach.filesystem.find_project_config_root<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>
python/tach/cache/setup.py[L7]: Import <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>tach.filesystem.find_project_config_root<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>
...</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Tach also supports:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li><a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/interfaces/" rel="nofollow">Public interfaces for modules</a></li>
<li><a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/deprecate" rel="nofollow">Deprecating individual dependencies</a></li>
<li><a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/layers" rel="nofollow">Layered architecture</a></li>
<li><a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/unchecked-modules" rel="nofollow">Incremental adoption</a></li>
<li><a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/configuration" rel="nofollow">Manual file configuration</a></li>
<li><a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/configuration#source-roots" rel="nofollow">Monorepos and namespace packages</a></li>
<li><a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/configuration#tach-domain-toml" rel="nofollow">Domain ownership</a></li>
<li><a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/tach-ignore" rel="nofollow">Inline 'ignore' comments</a></li>
<li><a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/commands#tach-install" rel="nofollow">Pre-commit hooks</a></li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">More info in the <a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/" rel="nofollow">docs</a>. Tach logs anonymized usage statistics which can be <a href="https://docs.gauge.sh/usage/faq/" rel="nofollow">opted out</a> of.
If you have any feedback, we'd love to talk!</p>
<p dir="auto">If you have any questions or run into any issues, let us know by either reaching out on <a href="https://discord.gg/Kz2TnszerR" rel="nofollow">Discord</a> or submitting a <a href="https://github.com/gauge-sh/tach/issues">Github Issue</a>!</p>
<hr/>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Contributors</h3><a aria-label="Permalink: Contributors" class="anchor" href="#contributors" id="user-content-contributors"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>

<div class="BorderGrid-row">
<div class="BorderGrid-cell">
<div class="hide-sm hide-md">
<h2 class="mb-3 h4">About</h2>
<p class="f4 my-3">
        A Python tool to visualize + enforce dependencies, using modular architecture 🌎 Open source 🐍 Installable via pip 🔧 Able to be adopted incrementally - ⚡ Implemented with no runtime impact ♾️ Interoperable with your existing systems 🦀 Written in rust
      </p>
<div class="my-3 d-flex flex-items-center">
<svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link flex-shrink-0 mr-2" data-view-component="true" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16">

<div>
<h3>Paper:</h3>
<div id="box" style="text-align: justify">
<div style="float:left;">
<small><b><u>
			TR25-017 | 24th February 2025 05:09
		</u></b></small><br/>
<h4>Simulating Time in Square-Root Space</h4>
</div>
<div style="float:right;">
<div class="menuIntern menuHoverIntern" onclick="location='mailto:rrwilliams@gmail.com'">

</div>

		Authors:

<div style="float:left;">Keywords: </div><br/><div style="float: left; margin-left:100px;">
<a href="/keyword/14193">Circuit Value Problem</a>, 
		
		<a href="/keyword/20493">multitape Turing machine</a>, 
		
		<a href="/keyword/20494">P versus PSPACE</a>, 
		
		<a href="/keyword/13959">space complexity</a>, 
		
		<a href="/keyword/13998">time complexity</a>, 
		
		<a href="/keyword/15430">time lower bound</a>, 
		
		<a href="/keyword/19859">tree evaluation problem</a>
</div>
</div>
<br/><b>Abstract:</b><br/>
<p>We show that for all functions $t(n) \geq n$, every multitape Turing machine running in time $t$ can be simulated in space only $O(\sqrt{t \log t})$. This is a substantial improvement over Hopcroft, Paul, and Valiant's simulation of time $t$ in $O(t/\log t)$ space from 50 years ago [FOCS 1975, JACM 1977]. Among other results, our simulation implies that bounded fan-in circuits of size $s$ can be evaluated on any input in only $\sqrt{s} \cdot poly(\log s)$ space, and that there are explicit problems solvable in $O(n)$ space which require $n^{2-\varepsilon}$ time on a multitape Turing machine for all $\varepsilon &gt; 0$, thereby making a little progress on the $P$ versus $PSPACE$ problem.</p>
<p>Our simulation reduces the problem of simulating time-bounded multitape Turing machines to a series of implicitly-defined Tree Evaluation instances with nice parameters, leveraging the remarkable space-efficient algorithm for Tree Evaluation recently found by Cook and Mertz [STOC 2024].</p>
</div>
</div>
<div style="clear:both;">
<br/>
<hr/>
<small>ISSN 1433-8092 | <a href="/static/website/imprint">Imprint</a></small>
</div>
</div>

</div></div></body>
</html>

dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eB+ Tree Storage Engine with Indexing Support\u003c/strong\u003e: Enables fast data retrieval, which is critical for database performance, especially in scenarios involving large datasets.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFree List Management for Node Reuse\u003c/strong\u003e: The database manages a free list to reuse nodes, which is a strategy to optimize storage usage by recycling space from freed nodes. This helps reduce fragmentation and improve disk space efficiency.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTransaction Support\u003c/strong\u003e: AtomixDB supports transactions, ensuring data consistency and integrity through atomic operations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eConcurrent Reads\u003c/strong\u003e: The ability to handle concurrent reads enhances performance by allowing multiple users to read data simultaneously without locking issues, making it suitable for read-heavy applications.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" itemprop="text"><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Overview</h1><a aria-label="Permalink: Overview" class="anchor" href="#overview" id="user-content-overview"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">AtomixDB is an mini relational database fully written in Go.
Main focus was on implementing &amp; understanding working the of database, storage management &amp; transaction handling.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Table of Contents</h2><a aria-label="Permalink: Table of Contents" class="anchor" href="#table-of-contents" id="user-content-table-of-contents"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>

<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Installation</h2><a aria-label="Permalink: Installation" class="anchor" href="#installation" id="user-content-installation"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Prerequisites</h3><a aria-label="Permalink: Prerequisites" class="anchor" href="#prerequisites" id="user-content-prerequisites"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li><a href="https://golang.org/dl/" rel="nofollow">Golang</a> (version 1.17 or later)</li>
<li><a href="https://git-scm.com/downloads" rel="nofollow">Git</a></li>
<li>Linux operating system. AtomixDB has been developed and tested on systems like NixOS.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Clone the Repository</h3><a aria-label="Permalink: Clone the Repository" class="anchor" href="#clone-the-repository" id="user-content-clone-the-repository"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Clone the repository to your local machine:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="git clone https://github.com/Sahilb315/AtomixDB.git &amp;&amp; cd AtomixDB" dir="auto"><pre>git clone https://github.com/Sahilb315/AtomixDB.git <span class="pl-k">&amp;&amp;</span> <span class="pl-c1">cd</span> AtomixDB</pre></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Build</h3><a aria-label="Permalink: Build" class="anchor" href="#build" id="user-content-build"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Build the project using Go:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="go build -o atomixdb" dir="auto"><pre>go build -o atomixdb</pre></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Run</h3><a aria-label="Permalink: Run" class="anchor" href="#run" id="user-content-run"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">To start the AtomixDB server, execute:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="./atomixdb" dir="auto"><pre>./atomixdb</pre></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Features</h2><a aria-label="Permalink: Features" class="anchor" href="#features" id="user-content-features"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>B+ Tree Storage Engine with Indexing Support</strong>: Enables fast data retrieval, which is critical for database performance, especially in scenarios involving large datasets.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Free List Management for Node Reuse</strong>: The database manages a free list to reuse nodes, which is a strategy to optimize storage usage by recycling space from freed nodes. This helps reduce fragmentation and improve disk space efficiency.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Transaction Support</strong>: AtomixDB supports transactions, ensuring data consistency and integrity through atomic operations.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Concurrent Reads</strong>: The ability to handle concurrent reads enhances performance by allowing multiple users to read data simultaneously without locking issues, making it suitable for read-heavy applications.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Upcoming Features</h2><a aria-label="Permalink: Upcoming Features" class="anchor" href="#upcoming-features" id="user-content-upcoming-features"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Query Processing</strong>: Enhancing AtomixDB with query capabilities to support more complex data retrieval and manipulation.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Bug Fixes</strong>: Ongoing efforts to address and resolve identified bugs to improve stability and reliability.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Supported Commands</h2><a aria-label="Permalink: Supported Commands" class="anchor" href="#supported-commands" id="user-content-supported-commands"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li><strong>CREATE</strong></li>
<li><strong>INSERT</strong></li>
<li><strong>GET</strong></li>
<li><strong>UPDATE</strong></li>
<li><strong>DELETE</strong></li>
<li><strong>BEGIN</strong></li>
<li><strong>COMMIT</strong></li>
<li><strong>ABORT</strong></li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">Contributing</h2><a aria-label="Permalink: Contributing" class="anchor" href="#contributing" id="user-content-contributing"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Contributions are welcome! If you’d like to contribute to AtomixDB, please follow these steps:</p>
<ol dir="auto">
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Fork the repository.</strong></p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Create a new branch:</strong> <code>git checkout -b feature/YourFeature</code></p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Commit your changes:</strong> <code>git commit -am "Add new feature"</code></p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Push to the branch:</strong> <code>git push origin feature/YourFeature</code></p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Open a Pull Request</strong> describing your changes and the problem they solve.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 class="heading-element" dir="auto" tabindex="-1">License</h2><a aria-label="Permalink: License" class="anchor" href="#license" id="user-content-license"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">AtomixDB is open-source software licensed under the <a href="/Sahilb315/AtomixDB/blob/main/LICENSE">MIT License</a>.</p>
